title: MS AccessConcat With &

metadata.description: Learn about MS AccessConcat With & with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Add 3 columns together into one "Address" column:
SELECT Address & ", " & PostalCode & ", " & City AS Address
FROM Customers;

Definition and Usage
The & operator allows you to add two or more strings together.
Syntax
string1
&
string2
&
string_n
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
string1, string2, string_n
Required. The strings to add together
Technical Details
Works in:
From Access 2000

❯
★
+1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
SELECT Address & ", " & PostalCode & ", " & City AS Address
FROM Customers;

summary: This tutorial covers MS AccessConcat With & concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MS AccessConcat With & effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MS AccessConcat With & and how to apply it in your projects.
